type.desc: Optional type (that has been previously registered) or one of the out of the box ones ('positive', 'negative', 'warning', 'info', 'ongoing')

caption.desc: The content of your optional caption

html.desc: Render the message as HTML; This can lead to XSS attacks, so make sure that you sanitize the message first

avatar.desc: URL to an avatar/image; Suggestion: use public folder

spinner.desc: Useful for notifications that are updated; Displays a Quasar spinner instead of an avatar or icon; If value is Boolean 'true' then the default QSpinner is shown

group.desc: Override the auto generated group with custom one; Grouped notifications cannot be updated; String or number value inform this is part of a specific group, regardless of its options; When a new notification is triggered with same group name, it replaces the old one and shows a badge with how many times the notification was triggered

badgeColor.desc: Color name for the badge from the Quasar Color Palette

badgeTextColor.desc: Color name for the badge text from the Quasar Color Palette

badgePosition.desc: Notification corner to stick badge to; If notification is on the left side then default is top-right otherwise it is top-left

badgeStyle.desc: Style definitions to be attributed to the badge

badgeClass.desc: Class definitions to be attributed to the badge

progress.desc: Show progress bar to detail when notification will disappear automatically (unless timeout is 0)

progressClass.desc: Class definitions to be attributed to the progress bar

classes.desc: Add CSS class(es) to the notification for easier customization

attrs.desc: Key-value for attributes to be set on the notification

timeout.desc: Amount of time to display (in milliseconds)

actions.desc: Notification actions (buttons); Unless 'noDismiss' is true, clicking/tapping on the button will close the notification; Also check 'closeBtn' convenience prop

handler.desc: Function to be executed when the button is clicked/tapped

noDismiss.desc: Do not dismiss the notification when the button is clicked/tapped

....desc: Any other QBtn prop expect 'onClick' (use 'handler' instead, only possible with UI config)

examples: [ { label: 'Show', handler: () => {}, 'aria-label': 'Button label' }, { icon: 'map', handler: () => {}, color: 'yellow' }, { label: 'Learn more', noDismiss: true, handler: () => {} } ]

onDismiss.desc: Function to call when notification gets dismissed

closeBtn.desc: Convenient way to add a dismiss button with a specific label, without using the 'actions' prop; If set to true, it uses a label according to the current Quasar language

multiLine.desc: Put notification into multi-line mode; If this prop isn't used and more than one 'action' is specified then notification goes into multi-line mode by default

create.desc: Creates a notification; Same as calling $q.notify(...)

type.desc: Optional type (that has been previously registered) or one of the out of the box ones ('positive', 'negative', 'warning', 'info', 'ongoing')

caption.desc: The content of your optional caption

html.desc: Render the message as HTML; This can lead to XSS attacks, so make sure that you sanitize the message first

avatar.desc: URL to an avatar/image; Suggestion: use public folder

spinner.desc: Useful for notifications that are updated; Displays a Quasar spinner instead of an avatar or icon; If value is Boolean 'true' then the default QSpinner is shown

group.desc: Override the auto generated group with custom one; Grouped notifications cannot be updated; String or number value inform this is part of a specific group, regardless of its options; When a new notification is triggered with same group name, it replaces the old one and shows a badge with how many times the notification was triggered

badgeColor.desc: Color name for the badge from the Quasar Color Palette

badgeTextColor.desc: Color name for the badge text from the Quasar Color Palette

badgePosition.desc: Notification corner to stick badge to; If notification is on the left side then default is top-right otherwise it is top-left

badgeStyle.desc: Style definitions to be attributed to the badge

badgeClass.desc: Class definitions to be attributed to the badge

progress.desc: Show progress bar to detail when notification will disappear automatically (unless timeout is 0)

progressClass.desc: Class definitions to be attributed to the progress bar

classes.desc: Add CSS class(es) to the notification for easier customization

attrs.desc: Key-value for attributes to be set on the notification

timeout.desc: Amount of time to display (in milliseconds)

actions.desc: Notification actions (buttons); Unless 'noDismiss' is true, clicking/tapping on the button will close the notification; Also check 'closeBtn' convenience prop

handler.desc: Function to be executed when the button is clicked/tapped

noDismiss.desc: Do not dismiss the notification when the button is clicked/tapped

....desc: Any other QBtn prop expect 'onClick' (use 'handler' instead)

examples: [ { label: 'Show', handler: () => {}, 'aria-label': 'Button label' }, { icon: 'map', handler: () => {}, color: 'yellow' }, { label: 'Learn more', noDismiss: true, handler: () => {} } ]

onDismiss.desc: Function to call when notification gets dismissed

closeBtn.desc: Convenient way to add a dismiss button with a specific label, without using the 'actions' prop; If set to true, it uses a label according to the current Quasar language

multiLine.desc: Put notification into multi-line mode; If this prop isn't used and more than one 'action' is specified then notification goes into multi-line mode by default

ignoreDefaults.desc: Ignore the default configuration (set by setDefaults()) for this instance only

returns.desc: Calling this function with no parameters hides the notification; When called with one Object parameter (the original notification must NOT be grouped), it updates the notification (specified properties are shallow merged with previous ones; note that group and position cannot be changed while updating and so they are ignored)

props.desc: Notification properties that will be shallow merged to previous ones in order to update the non-grouped notification; (See 'opts' param of 'create()' for object properties, except 'group' and 'position')

setDefaults.desc: Merge options into the default ones

opts.desc: Notification options except 'ignoreDefaults' (See 'opts' param of 'create()' for object properties)

registerType.desc: Register a new type of notification (or override an existing one)

typeName.desc: Name of the type (to be used as 'type' prop later on)

typeOpts.desc: Notification options except 'ignoreDefaults' (See 'opts' param of 'create()' for object properties)
